basics.name: Joshua Vangor
basics.label: Cybersecurity Professional | Infrastructure & Compliance Leader | CompTIA Security+ Certified

summary: Highly motivated Cybersecurity Professional leveraging Director-level experience in IT infrastructure, HIPAA compliance, and enterprise management to transition into a dedicated security role (e.g., Security Analyst, GRC Specialist). Proven leader in securing $150,000 in grants, driving network overhauls across five sites, and utilizing CompTIA Security+ and recent boot camp training for hands-on technical skills. Open to specialist and entry-level security positions where foundational technical aptitude and infrastructure expertise are valued.

work.name: Family Services of Chemung County
work.summary: Directed IT and cybersecurity initiatives across multiple sites, leading infrastructure modernization and compliance programs.
highlights: Directed a full network and security overhaul across five regional sites, improving network performance by 35% and establishing a standardized security baseline using CIS Benchmarks.
Spearheaded optimization of Microsoft 365 security suite, achieving a 30% increase in Microsoft Security Score and reducing cloud exposure risk.
Established and governed a formalized Vulnerability Management (VM) program using Nessus/Tenable, reducing overall attack surface exposure.
Developed and implemented log correlation and alerting pipelines in Splunk for continuous monitoring and threat detection.
Acted as a liaison for law enforcement, managing digital evidence and chain of custody for criminal investigations.
Ensured 100% HIPAA compliance through strict data encryption and control policies across all systems.
Authored and secured over $150,000 in grants for cybersecurity and infrastructure modernization projects.
Oversaw full IT asset lifecycle management, procurement, licensing, and vendor negotiations.
Provided IT consulting and strategic security guidance to partner agencies.
Led creation and enforcement of security policies and delivered security awareness training for 200+ staff, reducing human error risk.

work.name: The Beer Barn
work.summary: Managed and led a sales team, improving customer experience and operational efficiency
highlights: Directed a sales team of 8 employees, implementing process improvements that enhanced customer service metrics and optimized operational workflows
Improved data flow and reporting by serving as the primary communication bridge between user-level staff and management, ensuring clear requirements and feedback loops.
Applied critical thinking and root cause analysis to diagnose and resolve complex operational bottlenecks, ensuring business continuity and efficiency.

work.name: Custom Gaming PC Builds
work.summary: Managed the full life cycle of custom system builds for clients, encompassing component selection, procurement, integration, and performance testing of high-end hardware (CPUs, GPUs, Motherboards, RAM).
highlights: Executed advanced diagnostics and root cause analysis to isolate and resolve complex hardware and software conflicts, minimizing client downtime and ensuring system stability.
Provided end-user technical support and training, including advising clients on cybersecurity fundamentals, data backup protocols, and best practices for system maintenance and longevity.
Conducted full operating system deployment (Windows/Linux) and configured customized software stacks, including driver management, partitioning, and BIOS optimization.
